title: Melted Cheese, Silversmith's Style
introduction: Formaggio all'Argentiera, also known as Melted Cheese, Silversmith's Style, is a dish steeped in Sicilian tradition. Named after an elusive silversmith, this recipe creates a delightful illusion with aromatic cheese, garlic, vinegar, and oregano, evoking the scent of roasted meat. This savory delight pairs perfectly with crisp bread and a bottle of red wine, making it a staple in Italian cuisine.

ingredients.item: imported provolone, caciocavallo, or Asiago cheese

instructions.description: Remove the rind from the cheese and cut the cheese into 1/2-inch-thick slices.
In a large heavy skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until just beginning to turn golden, 1 to 2 minutes.
Place the cheese slices in a single layer on top of the garlic. Raise the heat and add the vinegar. Cook 1 to 2 minutes or until the cheese just begins to melt.

With a metal spatula, quickly turn the slices and sprinkle with the oregano. Cook 1 to 2 minutes more or until the cheese is slightly melted and bubbling around the edges. Transfer to serving dishes and serve hot.
